https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/61667/ : SUCCESS
Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 6c068982d54d20476fd04ae7ef893b153015762e

Ack. The purpose of having this, is so the client knows aggregation is supported and some the resources might be aggregated. The resource itsel,f as is, isn't much but makes sense we have it for the use case mentioned.

Nitpick: Description ?
I almost think Description should be above in common properties.
I don't see all of these includes used

Is the idea that this field only indicates that we could aggregate?  We don't aggregate if there aren't any satellite configs, but "ServiceEnabled" is not a consideration of if satellite configs exist?

The indication of whether or not any aggregation will actually occur will be indicated by the existence or lack thereof of a something like AggregationSource resources https://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP2046_2022.3.pdf#page=117?

Or should we tie the value of "ServiceEnabled" to the existence of satellite configs and let the existence of /redfish/v1/AggregationService indicate that aggregation is possible.

> Is the idea that this field only indicates that we could aggregate?  We don't aggregate if there aren't any satellite configs, but "ServiceEnabled" is not a consideration of if satellite configs exist?

That's the thinking.  ServiceEnabled on it's own isn't super useful.  My thinking was AggregationSourceCollection makes it more useful.

> 
> The indication of whether or not any aggregation will actually occur will be indicated by the existence or lack thereof of a something like AggregationSource resources https://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP2046_2022.3.pdf#page=117?

Yep

> 
> Or should we tie the value of "ServiceEnabled" to the existence of satellite configs and let the existence of /redfish/v1/AggregationService indicate that aggregation is possible.

I'm keying off what we did elsewhere in things like EventService, where if it's possible, it's enabled, regardless of whether you have anything else set up.  While that definition is subjective, I think it's still correct.

> > Is the idea that this field only indicates that we could aggregate? We don't aggregate if there aren't any satellite configs, but "ServiceEnabled" is not a consideration of if satellite configs exist?
> That's the thinking. ServiceEnabled on it's own isn't super useful. My thinking was AggregationSourceCollection makes it more useful.

> > Or should we tie the value of "ServiceEnabled" to the existence of satellite configs and let the existence of /redfish/v1/AggregationService indicate that aggregation is possible.

> I'm keying off what we did elsewhere in things like EventService, where if it's possible, it's enabled, regardless of whether you have anything else set up. While that definition is subjective, I think it's still correct.

SGTM
nit, move this down one to preserve the list being alphabetical.
nit, should this be v1_0_1 instead?

nit, calling this requestRoutesAggregationService would be more consistent with the naming convention used elsewhere.  I can change it in one of my later patches in the chain since this is already +2.
